title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: Bubble (per HAI) X = annual HAIs (cases), Y = attributable deaths; bubble size = DALYs. Hover tooltips show 95% UI cases / deaths / DALYs. Bar (per HAI) Choose metric (HAIs / Deaths / DALYs). Bars colour-coded HAI type. Vertical error bars = 95% UI. Geo comparison (per N) Compare German PPS vs ECDC PPS (EU/EEA) chosen metric, rates per N people. Use slider change N (e.g. 1,000 … 100,000). Error bars show 95% UI. Overlapping intervals suggest limited separation. Read summary text plot: HAI prints Type - German PPS shows X per N ECDC PPS shows Y per N ([’s higher] Δ). updates live move slider switch metric (also say Tie values equal).

title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: reflect app’s features meant followed inside UI. Launch app HAI drives largest mortality Germany? Go Bar (per HAI) → set Metric = “Deaths”. Read bar tallest; hover bar see 95% UI. Tip: two intervals overlap substantially, don’t -interpret small height difference. Relative burden across cases, deaths, DALYs Stay Bar (per HAI) switch Metric among HAIs / Deaths / DALYs. Note UTI may dominate cases, BSI/HAP contribute deaths DALYs. Germany vs EU/EEA comparison preferred scale Open Geo comparison (per N), choose Metric = “DALYs”. Set per N 100,000 (public-health standard), try 10,000 match smaller constituencies; values rescale linearly. Check summary text plot HAI prints Magnitude check multiple HAI types Bubble (per HAI), toggle HAI types sidebar focus subset. Larger bubbles higher positions indicate greater overall burden (DALYs / deaths), even case counts moderate. Communicating uncertainty Prefer plots error bars (Bar / Geo comparison) slides reports. Use Bubble tooltips live demos keep visuals clean retaining full numeric context.

title: Getting started with BHAIBYE
text: package produced context academic assignment. Package scaffolding documentation made much easier thanks R packaging ecosystem — particularly usethis, devtools, roxygen2. Interactive exploration built shiny, plotly, ggplot2; data wrangling utilities rely dplyr, tidyr, scales; theming uses bslib. Concepts, data structure, interpretation follow BHAI approach described Zacher et al. (2019) Eurosurveillance:https://www.eurosurveillance.org/content/10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2019.24.46.1900135#html_fulltext Please refer package LICENSE file terms use redistribution. mistakes oversights .
